title: Default implementation of CrateNum encoding/decoding should be disabled

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The [default implementation](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/c38111c4fb9c22a36f9a9195d1884052bb670af2/compiler/rustc_span/src/def_id.rs#L41-L53) for `CrateNum` encoding and decoding should be disabled because the numeric value of a `CrateNum` can only be meaningfully interpreted giving the specific context of decoding (which the default decoder does not have access to). We already do [something similar](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/c38111c4fb9c22a36f9a9195d1884052bb670af2/compiler/rustc_span/src/def_id.rs#L168-L178) for `DefIndex` because it helps prevent bugs where decoding *seems*  to work but really provides wrong values.

I already tried to make this change as part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/86368 (see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/3eaeb92b96ddf2db764fc634351f211818e6e6a8) but it turns out there's still [one user of the default implementation](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/cc9610bf5af1d5c54968db0dd899595ca12307a0/compiler/rustc_interface/src/queries.rs#L407-L417) related to `-Zno-link`.
